{"id":1432826106,"question_id":390,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"3 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1729803627,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"0 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1432826106/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Elimination Game","memory":"9.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int lastRemaining(int n) {\n        return leftToRight(n);\n    }\n    int leftToRight(int n) { //// eliminate [1...n] first from left to right, then alternate\n        if(n==1)\n            return 1;\n        // scan from left to right is simple, the length of array doesn't matter\n        // [1, 2, 3, 4] -> 2 * [1, 2]\n        // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] -> 2 * [1, 2]\n        return 2 * rightToLeft(n/2);\n    }\n    int rightToLeft(int n) {\n        if(n==1)\n            return 1;\n        // if the length of array is even, we will get only odd number\n        // [1, 2, 3, 4] -> [1, 3] = 2 * [1, 2] - 1\n        if(n % 2 == 0)\n            return 2*leftToRight(n/2) - 1;\n        // else if the length of array is odd, we will get only even number\n        // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] -> [2, 4] = 2 * [1, 2]\n        else\n            return 2*leftToRight(n/2);        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"elimination-game","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
